message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.CV. 

This paper proposes a new regularization technique for neural machine translation systems, which falls under the category of natural language processing (NLP) and machine learning (ML). Therefore, cs.CL (Computation and Language) is the most likely sub-category. The proposed technique involves regressing word embeddings, which is a form of feature engineering and representation learning, making cs.LG (Machine Learning) the second likely sub-category. The paper also involves training a joint model to predict both categorical and continuous values, which involves optimization and learning algorithms, making cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) a likely sub-category as well. Additionally, the proposed technique can be applied to improve the generalization of neural networks, which is a common problem in many domains, making cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) a possible sub-category. Finally, the proposed technique involves working with word embeddings, which are often used in computer vision tasks as well, making cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) a less likely but still possible sub-category.
